errors.error_description: The instructions suggest running the 'Hello World' example code *before* installing the Lark library, which is the wrong order and will fail.
correction_candidates: Remove the sentence: 'First, run the following Python code to test your setup. After it runs successfully, you can install Lark using the instructions above.'
Move the 'Install Lark' section to be before the 'Hello World' section.
Change the sentence to: 'After installing Lark, run the following Python code to test your setup.'
Add a note saying 'This code requires Lark to be installed first.'
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence: 'First, run the following Python code to test your setup. After it runs successfully, you can install Lark using the instructions above.'

errors.error_description: The string input in the 'Hello World' example code is 'Hello World!', which is missing the comma required by the grammar `start: WORD "," WORD "!"`. This will cause the parse to fail and also makes the example output incorrect.
correction_candidates: Change the input string in the code to `l.parse("Hello, World!")`.
Change the grammar in the code to `start: WORD WORD "!"`.
Change the grammar in the code to `start: WORD ","? WORD "!"` to make the comma optional.
Change the input string in the code to `l.parse('Hello, World!')`.
errors.golden_answer: Change the input string in the code to `l.parse("Hello, World!")`.
